9/body/4/argument/3/1/expression/alterna.content: There was a problem connecting to GitHub. Please check your connection and try searching again.
Press <element:kbd>‚åòK</element:kbd> or <element:kbd>Ctrl+K</element:kbd> to search for issues

5/0/init/body/15/argument/11/expression/.content: These are potential problems automatically detected in your backlog:
Click through to the grooming view to start addressing these issues.

5/0/init/body/15/argument/15/3/1/3/openi.content: Shows how long issues have been open:
‚Ä¢ <element:strong>Fresh (0-7d):</element:strong> Brand new issues with full context

5/0/init/body/15/argument/15/7/1/3/openi.content: <element:strong>Healthy pyramid:</element:strong> Few high, some medium, many low priority items
‚Ä¢ <element:strong>High:</element:strong> Urgent, blocking, or critical business value
‚Ä¢ <element:strong>Low:</element:strong> Nice to have or future considerations

5/0/init/body/15/argument/19/1/3/opening.content: Tracks the flow of work through your backlog:
‚Ä¢ <element:strong>Issues Created:</element:strong> New issues added to backlog
‚Ä¢ <element:strong>Avg Days to Groom:</element:strong> Time from creation to prioritization
<element:strong>Ideal:</element:strong> Grooming keeps pace with creation, fast triage (<expression/>7 days)

5/0/init/body/15/argument/23/3/1/express.content: ‚Ä¢ <element:strong>Priority Focus:</element:strong> You have {metrics.priorityBalance.ungroomed} ungroomed issues. Use Command+K to search and prioritize the most important ones.

5/0/init/body/15/argument/23/3/3/express.content: ‚Ä¢ <element:strong>Speed Up Grooming:</element:strong> Issues are taking <function:Math.round/> days to groom on average. Aim for under 7 days to maintain context.

5/0/init/body/15/argument/23/3/5/express.content: ‚Ä¢ <element:strong>Clean Old Issues:</element:strong> Consider closing or re-evaluating <expression/> old issues that may no longer be relevant.

5/0/init/body/15/argument/23/3/7/express.content: ‚Ä¢ <element:strong>Manage Intake:</element:strong> High creation rate ({metrics.velocity.issuesCreatedLast30Days} issues/month). Consider filtering or batching new issues.

5/0/init/body/15/argument/3/1/3/openingE.content: This dashboard analyzes your entire backlog to identify potential problems and track key health metrics. A healthy backlog has a good mix of fresh and recent issues, balanced priorities, and steady grooming velocity.

5/0/init/body/15/argument/7/1/1/5/openin.content: Composite score combining age, priority, and velocity health:
Based on weighted average: Age (40%) + Priority (40%) + Velocity (20%)

5/0/init/body/15/argument/7/3/1/5/openin.content: Measures how fresh your backlog is:
<element:strong>Why it matters:</element:strong> Old issues become harder to understand and implement. Fresh issues have better context.

5/0/init/body/15/argument/7/5/1/5/openin.content: ‚Ä¢ Healthy pyramid: More low/medium than high priority
‚Ä¢ Penalizes too many high priority items
<element:strong>Why it matters:</element:strong> Everything can't be high priority. Good prioritization helps focus effort on what matters most.

5/0/init/body/15/argument/7/7/1/5/openin.content: Measures how quickly you groom issues:
‚Ä¢ Based on average days from creation to grooming
<element:strong>Why it matters:</element:strong> Fast grooming means better context retention and quicker value delivery.

4/0/init/body/11/argument/1/3/1/5.content: Use GitHub's search syntax. The query will be automatically scoped to komo-tech/komo-platform.

4/0/init/body/11/argument/1/3/7/1/3.content: This will replace your current issue list

2/0/init/body/0/argument/3.content: Use Command K to search and load issues from GitHub.

2/0/init/body/0/argument/7.content: Search by labels, dates, or any GitHub query syntax
